title: Prince Harry and Meghan's children will use royal titles following Lilibet's christening
description: Prince Harry and Meghan indicated for the first time that their children will use royal titles, making them Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet Diana.

title: Exiled Afghan girls robotics team makes a home in Qatar, mourning the lives they left behind
description: A member of the pioneering Afghan girls robotics team wants the world to know that after the Taliban takeover, women in her homeland are thirsting for education.

title: Iran enriching uranium to near weapons-grade levels, nuclear watchdog warns
description: Iran has begun enriching uranium close to weapons-grade levels, according to a report released by the United Nations nuclear watchdog Wednesday.

title: Viking treasure reveals oldest reference to Norse god Odin
description: A centuries-old gold disc found in Denmark has revealed the earliest known mention of the Norse god Odin and shown he was being worshipped at least 150 years earlier than previously thought.

title: China wants to avoid escalation with U.S., favors stable relations, U.S. spy chief says
description: China wants to avoid escalation of tensions with the U.S., even as it bolsters its global power, U.S. intelligence chief Avril Haines told the Senate Wednesday.

title: China has become a tough target for U.S. spies
description: Under Xi Jinping’s rule, China has become an elusive target for U.S. intelligence agencies, say four former senior intelligence officials and congressional aides.

title: Afghanistan is world’s most repressive country for women, U.N. says
description: Since the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan, the country has become the most repressive in the world for women and girls, deprived of many of their basic rights, the United Nations said Wednesday.

title: German authorities searched ship suspected in Nord Stream pipeline explosions
description: German authorities said Wednesday they had searched a vessel suspected of carrying explosives used in the mysterious sabotage of the Nord Stream gas pipelines.

title: An 'unforgivable crime': What's behind the crisis in Iran over the suspected poisoning of schoolgirls?
description: The crisis over a wave of suspected poisonings that have hit thousands of schoolgirls across Iran escalated Tuesday, with the first arrests reported after Ayatollah Ali Khamenei made his first public comments on the issue.

title: Georgian police use tear gas to halt protest against ‘foreign agents’ law
description: TBILISI, Georgia — Police in the ex-Soviet state of Georgia used tear gas and stun grenades early on Wednesday to break up a protest outside Parliament against a draft law on “foreign agents.”

title: Deadly kidnapping of Americans in Mexico highlights dangers of cartel-run border towns, expert say
description: Gunfire Americans encountered in a Mexican town that killed two is nearly impossible to prevent and signifies the perils of the southern border, experts say.

title: Israeli troops kill at least 6 Palestinians in raids carried out in broad daylight
description: Israeli forces stormed into a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin, killing at least six Palestinians in a broad daylight raid.

title: China’s foreign minister says U.S. needs to change course with China or risk ‘conflict’
description: Beijing’s new foreign minister said the U.S. needs to change course or risk “confrontation and conflict” with China, demonstrating escalating tensions between the two superpowers. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell reports.
